message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR, cs.MM

The paper deals with learning overcomplete dictionaries composed of two modalities (image intensity and scene depth) to describe a 3D scene. This involves developing a novel Joint Basis Pursuit (JBP) algorithm that finds related sparse features in two modalities using conic programming and integrating it into a two-step dictionary learning algorithm. The paper also discusses theoretical bounds for the sparse coefficient recovery error obtained by JBP and shows experimental results on the Middlebury depth-intensity database. Given these details, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is computer vision (cs.CV), followed by machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also involves some aspects of graphics (cs.GR) and multimedia (cs.MM), which are less likely but still relevant sub-categories.
